Taxon name.Name: Rhodococcus ruber
Taxon name.Synonymy: Current name: Rhodococcus ruber (Kruse 1896) Goodfellow and Alderson 1977 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Nouioui et al. 2018 MB#

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: documents providing proof of legal access and terms of use available at the collection
Isolator: Water, the Upper Ilitch river, Russia
Metabolites production: Produces biosurfactants when growing on n-alkanes (C10-C17)
Applications: Uses propane, n-butane and liquid n-alkanes (C5-C7, C11-C16) as a sole carbon source; produces biosurfactants when growing on n-alkanes (C10-C17); exhibits antilysozyme activity; adheres to liquid hydrocarbons (n-hexadecane); resistant to 1-butanol, ethanol; resistant to Pb2+ (5.0 mM).
